alert.note: Alert for Carter; Custer; Fallon; Golden Valley; Musselshell; Powder River; Rosebud; Treasure; Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 05 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Ice Jam flooding on rivers and streams possible... With much warmer temperatures in the forecast from Friday through Tuesday, snowmelt is expected to increase and run off into area streams and rivers. The combination of snowmelt runoff into streams breaking up ice, and existing river ice releasing with the warmth, will increase the potential for ice to become piled up resulting in ice jam formation and localized flooding. Ice jams impede water flows, sometimes pushing water and ice over the banks causing flooding with little warning. Water rises can be measured in feet per minute on larger waterways, quickly inundating surrounding land. Getting caught in flood waters caused by ice jams means navigating through ice cold water that is full of moving icebergs which may weigh several tons. Hypothermia is likely and injury or death is possible should you have to escape through these flood waters. While flooding is not imminent, those living near rivers or streams should pay close attention to the state of the ice over the next week or two. Move any equipment or livestock away from low lying areas adjacent to rivers or streams. Take protective action for any threatened structures. Be prepared to seek the safety of higher ground should waters rise. If you are observing the river, please do so from a safe distance and elevation, stay away from the ice edge. Water from ice jams can rise faster than you can move to safety, and may come in behind you leaving you stranded in a very dangerous position. Please report any flooding to local law enforcement and have them relay the report to the National Weather Service.
